title: Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge to boast 4GB of RAM, say analysts | Trusted Reviews
description:
![samsung galaxy
s5](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**The[Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge](https://www.trustedreviews.com/samsung-
galaxy-s6-edge-review) could land with a mega 4GB of RAM on board, if Korean
analysts are to be believed.**

Industry hounds from Korea Investment & Securities (via
[PhoneArena](http://www.phonearena.com/news/Korean-analysts-see-4GB-of-RAM-
for-Samsung-Galaxy-S6-Edge_id64997)) reckon the [Note
Edge](https://www.trustedreviews.com/samsung-galaxy-edge-review)-style Galaxy
S6 spin-off will make use of boosted RAM.

The analysts do maintain, however, that the [Samsung Galaxy
S6](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/samsung-galaxy-s6-release-date-
rumours-news-specs-and-price) proper will land with a safer 3GB of memory
inside.

For perspective, the current flagship smartphone – the [Samsung Galaxy
S5](https://www.trustedreviews.com/samsung-galaxy-s5-review) – makes use of
2GB of RAM, while Apple’s [iPhone
6](https://www.trustedreviews.com/iphone-6-review) uses just 1GB.

The Edge variant is expected to come with a 1440 x 2560 Super AMOLED display,
a 20-megapixel rear-facing camera, and a 5-megapixel front-facing sensor to
boot.

A metal (or part metal, at least) chassis is [also rumoured to
appear](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/samsung-yet-to-decide-if-
galaxy-s6-will-have-full-metal-jacket) for both (or either) the Edge and the
S6 proper, marking a departure from Samsung’s typically plastic-laden efforts
of previous years.

We’re also expecting to see an Exynos chip at the core of at least one of the
devices, as rumours fly that Samsung wants to focus on its own SoCs rather
than relying on Qualcomm’s Snapdragon series (the latest of which has
reportedly [been plagued with overheating
issues](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/snapdragon-810-delay-claims-
resurface-despite-qualcomm-denial)).

Both S6-stamped devices are tipped for a March launch, likely entering tech-
dom at this year’s Mobile World Congress event over in Barcelona.

MWC runs from March 2 to 5, and is sure to see some of this year’s hottest
flagship smartphones and tablets debut.

The [Sony Xperia Z4](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/sony-
xperia-z4-release-date-rumours-news-specs-and-price), the [LG
G4](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/lg-g4-release-date-rumours-news-specs-
